table.caption: Table 313 — Animation styles
head: Style
Description
rows:
Keyframe animations is not driven directly by the interactive PDF processor. This value is used by documents that are intended to drive animations through an alternative means, such as ECMAScript.
The remaining entries in the animation style dictionary is ignored.

Keyframe animations is driven linearly from beginning to end. This animation style results in a repetitive playthrough of the animation, such as in a walking motion. t=(m(ta−t0)+r0) % (r1−r0) p=(r1−r0)/m
The "%" symbol indicates the modulus operator.

Keyframe animations oscillates along their time range. This animation style results in a back-and-forth playing of the animation, such as exploding or collapsing parts. 𝑡=0.5(𝑟1−𝑟0)(1−𝑐𝑜𝑠(𝑚(𝑡𝑎−𝑡0)))+𝑟0 𝑝=2∗𝑝𝑖/𝑚
